title: 107_s1760
content: The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2001" allows coverage of marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services under Part B of the Medicare program. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2001" expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services. The Medicare Act of 2000 is amended to include new definitions in subsection (ww)(3). The Medicare Act of 2000 is amended to include new definitions for Marriage and Family Therapist Services, Marriage and Family Therapist, Mental Health Counselor Services, and Mental Health Counselor. The Medicare Act of 2000 now defines 'marriage and family therapist services' as services provided by a therapist for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illnesses, authorized by state law. A 'marriage and family therapist' is an individual with a master's or doctoral degree who meets state licensure requirements. The term 'mental health counselor services' refers to services provided by a mental health counselor for diagnosing and treating mental illnesses as authorized by state law. The counselor must have a master's or doctoral degree, complete 2 years of supervised clinical experience, and be licensed or certified in the state where services are performed. The term 'mental health counselor' refers to an individual with a master's or doctor's degree in mental health counseling, at least 2 years of supervised practice, and state licensure or certification. Payment for mental health counselor services is provided under Part B of the Act. The Medicare Act is amended to include payment for marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services under section 1861(s)(2)(W). The Medicare Act is amended to include payment for marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services under section 1861(s)(2)(W). This excludes certain mental health services from the skilled nursing facility prospective payment system. The Medicare Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services. Marriage and family therapists and mental health counselors are now recognized as practitioners for assignment of claims. The Medicare Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services in various healthcare settings. This allows for coverage of these services in rural health clinics, federally qualified health centers, and hospice programs. The Medicare Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services in discharge plans for post-hospital services. The amendments apply to services furnished on or after January 1, 2002.
